title: How to Shoot Macro Using a Reversal Ring

steps.headline: Be sure that the thread is the right size.
steps.description: This example is a 52mm reversal ring. You can also use adapter rings, called 'step up' or 'step down' adapters. This adapter is sitting on top of a lens cap to raise it off of the desktop.

steps.headline: Make sure that the mount is the right one for your camera.
Fasten the reversal ring to the 'filter' side of the lens.
Carefully attach the lens to the camera.
Test it out by looking at something that you are familiar with.
steps.description: Examples might be your finger tip, or a coin.

steps.headline: Remember that you lose all electrical connections that you would normally have with your camera.
Be prepared for some degree of softness to the image.
Experiment with light options.
steps.description: Because the lens is turned around, what you expect to happen in regards to light, may change.

steps.headline: Be sure to use a tripod.
steps.description: Your depth of field will be extremely restricted. A tripod will help with the focus.
